title: Man arrested for murder of Mark Beale in Haumoana
text:
Man arrested for murder of Mark Beale in Haumoana MARTY SHARPE Last updated 13:52, February 24 2017 SUPPLIED 
Mark Beale, who was found unconscious at Haumoana, Hawke's Bay on the morning of February 6, 2017. 
﻿ Police have charged a man with the murder of Mark Beale. 
The 45-year-old father of two was found unconscious and critically injured near the mouth of the Tukituki River in the seaside Hawke's Bay settlement of Haumoana about 7am on Monday, February 6. He was taken to Hawke's Bay Hospital but later died. 
Inspector Mike Foster said a 19-year-old man had been arrested and charged with murder on Friday afternoon. SUPPLIED 
The family were keen fishermen. 
He would appear in Hastings District Court on Saturday. 
READ MORE: SUPPLIED 
Mark Beale with his sons Jareb, centre, and Zane. 
Foster said the area was an extremely popular fishing area and there had been a lot of people, including a number of families, there on the evening before Beale's body was found. 
Beale died from extensive head injuries. Beale had lived alone in a house on Grange Rd North for a couple of years and frequently fished or set nets in the estuary area where his body was found. 
Beale was the father of Jareb​, 25, and Zane, 23. Jareb described him as "an extremely generous and selfless man". SUPPLIED 
Mark Beale died after an assault at Haumoana, in Hawke's Bay. 
Beale had been between jobs and was creating an online business around search engine optimisation when he was killed. Ad Feedback 
Jareb, who lives in Levin, last saw his dad before Christmas. The pair went for a bike ride to Clifton, near Cape Kidnappers. 
Beale, who was raised in Wairoa, loved fishing, and he loved setting his net near the site his body was found. SIMON HENDERY/FAIRFAX NZ 
Police staff at Haumoana, not far from where the injured Beale was discovered. 
"It's very sad. The place he was happiest was probably where he was assaulted. He did love that place," Jareb said.
